snippet: A new federal report says Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey exaggerated the projected cost of a new train tunnel, the nation’s largest public works project, when he scrapped it in 2010.
abstract: Federal report says that New Jersey Gov Chris Christie exaggerated the projected cost of a new train tunnel designed to relieve congested routes across the Hudson River when he scrapped plan in 2010; canceling the tunnel, then the largest public works project in the nation, helped shape Christie's reputation as a rising Republican star and enforcer of fiscal discipline.
lead_paragraph: A new federal report says Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey exaggerated the projected cost of a new train tunnel, the nation’s largest public works project, when he scrapped it in 2010.

headline.seo: Report Disputes Christie’s Reason for Halting Tunnel Project in 2010
headline.main: Report Disputes Christie’s Basis for Halting Tunnel
headline.print_headline: Report Disputes Christie’s Basis for Halting Train Tunnel
